latest news.eng_title: Baltimore Orioles at Boston Red Sox odds, picks and predictions
latest news.summary: The Baltimore Orioles (82-63) and Boston Red Sox (73-71) play the 2nd game of a 3-game series on Tuesday. The Orioles need a win to stay 1½ games behind the AL East-leading New York Yankees. They have done well against the Red Sox this season, taking 7 of the 11 meetings and outscoring Boston 66-54. The recommended bet is the Orioles (-108) to win, as they have a good shot to get back on track. Additionally, the recommended bet is the Under 9.5 (-118) in the total, as the Under has hit in 3 of the last 5 meetings and both pitchers, RHP Albert Suarez and RHP Kutter Crawford, have been reliable for Under bettors.
latest news.title: Baltimore Orioles at Boston Red Sox odds, picks and predictions

latest news.eng_title: MLB Power Rankings: Yankees Continue to Fall, Red Sox Slip, NL Team Surges
latest news.summary: With the MLB regular season nearing its conclusion, playoff races are heating up in both the American and National Leagues. The New York Yankees have a half-game lead over the Baltimore Orioles, but have lost seven of their last 11 games. The Red Sox, who were once a threat for a Wild Card berth, have gone 5-11 since August 22 and are now four games out of the third and final Wild Card spot in the AL. Meanwhile, the San Diego Padres have a half-game lead over the Arizona Diamondbacks and a two-game lead over the Atlanta Braves in the NL. The Braves are hanging onto a playoff spot for dear life, as they have an identical record to the New York Mets. The Yankees have called up their top prospect, outfielder Jasson Dominguez, in an attempt to boost their struggling offense.
latest news.title: MLB Power Rankings: Yankees Continue to Fall, Red Sox Slip, NL Team Surges

latest news.eng_title: MLB Analyst Has Grim Prediction for Baltimore Orioles in AL East Race
latest news.summary: The Baltimore Orioles' chances in the American League East (AL East) race are looking grim, according to MLB analyst Rowan Kavner of Fox Sports. Kavner stated, 'After the Yankees' recent slide, it's basically a toss-up right now. But as poorly as it has gone for the Bronx Bombers of late, they still get to play Oakland and Pittsburgh before season's end. Meanwhile, the worst teams the Orioles will see are the Rays, Giants and Tigers, who are all worthy adversaries. If they played the same opponents the rest of the way, I'd take the O's. But they don't, so I'm leaning Yankees.' The Orioles' remaining schedule is a concern, with 12 of their last 18 games on the road, including tough matchups against the Boston Red Sox and Detroit Tigers. They will only play three games against a team currently under .500, the San Francisco Giants, and even that series is expected to be challenging.
latest news.title: MLB Analyst Has Grim Prediction for Baltimore Orioles in AL East Race

latest news.eng_title: Yankees and Orioles are in a dead heat in the AL East, but does anyone actually want to win the division? - CBSSports.com
latest news.summary: The Yankees and Orioles are in a close race for the AL East title, but neither team seems to be performing well. The Orioles are on pace to win 92 games, but that would be a significant step back from their 101 wins last season. They have been mediocre since the All-Star break, with a .500 record and a lackluster performance against weaker teams. The Yankees have also been struggling, with a losing record since June and a mediocre performance in the second half. Their offense is heavily reliant on Juan Soto and Aaron Judge, and when they go through slumps, the team loses games. Despite some bright spots in the rotation, the team's bullpen has a litany of issues. It's unlikely that either team will win the division, but they will likely finish in the top wild-card spot. The 'battle' for the AL East title will likely bleed into the final week, with a three-game series between the Orioles and Yankees in the Bronx.
latest news.title: Yankees and Orioles are in a dead heat in the AL East, but does anyone actually want to win the division? - CBSSports.com

latest news.eng_title: Orioles magic number tracker: When and how Baltimore can clinch a playoff spot
latest news.summary: The Baltimore Orioles are in striking distance of clinching a playoff spot with a 82-62 record, half a game behind the New York Yankees (82-61) in the American League East. Their magic number to secure a playoff spot is 10, which can fall by one with each Orioles win and can also drop with losses by the best team not in a wild-card spot. The Orioles can clinch a playoff spot as early as Saturday, but it's more likely to happen during their next homestand against the San Francisco Giants and Tigers from September 17-22. According to FanGraphs, the Orioles have a 99.8% chance of playing in October. The Orioles and Yankees have been tied or within two games of each other since July 10, and the tiebreaker is pivotal in determining who claims the division crown. If the Orioles win the AL East, it will be their first time claiming the division crown in back-to-back seasons since 1973-74.
latest news.title: Orioles magic number tracker: When and how Baltimore can clinch a playoff spot

news knowledge.eng_title: Baltimore Orioles Receive Massive Late-Season Prediction
news knowledge.summary: The Baltimore Orioles are in a tight battle with the New York Yankees for the American League East division title, with 21 games remaining in the regular season. Fox Sports MLB analyst Mark Sweeney predicts that the Orioles will win the division, citing the Yankees' lack of inspired play. Sweeney stated, 'I think the Orioles are going to win, and the reason why is there's something going on with the Yankees. And you can see they're not playing inspired baseball when they have to.' The Orioles will face off against the Yankees in a crucial three-game series from September 24th to 26th, which could decide the division winner. The Orioles have been inconsistent over the past month, but Sweeney's prediction suggests that they can get back to their dominant form. The final series between the two teams will be a heated and deciding factor in the division title.
news knowledge.title: Baltimore Orioles Receive Massive Late-Season Prediction

news knowledge.eng_title: Can Baltimore Orioles Maximize Key Advantage During Playoff Race?
news knowledge.summary: The Baltimore Orioles are in a strong position to win the AL East division and secure a playoff spot, trailing the New York Yankees by just 1.5 games with 26 games remaining. The Orioles have a crucial advantage with one of the easiest schedules in baseball, with only one more series against a playoff-bound team until late September. They have five more games against bottom-feeders and 15 games against teams hovering around .500, which they can use to post a winning record and clinch a postseason berth. Orioles' designated hitter Eloy Jimenez said, 'Hopefully the Orioles don't squander' the gift of an easy schedule, given by the MLB schedule-makers. If they take care of business, October baseball will be guaranteed, but if they struggle, their season may go down to the wire.
news knowledge.title: Can Baltimore Orioles Maximize Key Advantage During Playoff Race?

news knowledge.eng_title: Yankees climb above Orioles, Guardians to secure best record in MLB for first time since June
news knowledge.summary: The New York Yankees have secured the best record in Major League Baseball for the first time since June 21. Their win over the Tigers, combined with losses by the Orioles and Guardians, gave them the top spot in the MLB standings. The Yankees had a poor stretch from June 7 to July 26, losing 15 times in 26 games, but have since rebounded with a 13-5 record in their last 18 games. However, their lead is precarious, and they could fall to second place in the AL East if they lose and the Orioles win on Saturday. The Yankees have two games remaining against the Tigers and will host the Guardians next week, while their final series against the Orioles is scheduled for September 24-26 at Yankee Stadium.
news knowledge.title: Yankees climb above Orioles, Guardians to secure best record in MLB for first time since June

news knowledge.eng_title: How Yankees' remaining schedule could be a huge advantage over Orioles in tight AL East battle - CBSSports.com
news knowledge.summary: The New York Yankees and Baltimore Orioles are tied for first place in the American League East with a 67-46 record. The team that wins the division will receive a first-round bye in the playoffs. The Yankees and Orioles have 49 games remaining, with the Yankees playing 28 of those games at home and the Orioles playing 22. The Yankees have a slightly easier schedule, with an average 2024 winning percentage of .477 for their remaining opponents, ranking 27th in MLB. In contrast, the Orioles' remaining opponents have an average 2024 winning percentage of .490, ranking 23rd in MLB. The Yankees will play 18 of 21 games against teams with losing records, while the Orioles will face 17 winning teams in 22 games. As the season concludes, the Yankees' more accommodating schedule gives them a bit of an advantage over the Orioles.
news knowledge.title: How Yankees' remaining schedule could be a huge advantage over Orioles in tight AL East battle - CBSSports.com

news knowledge.eng_title: Yankees have key advantage over Orioles, Guardians in final playoff push
news knowledge.summary: The New York Yankees have regained their momentum, winning five consecutive games, including a sweep of the Philadelphia Phillies. With the final two months of the season approaching, the Yankees have a significant advantage, boasting the third-easiest strength of schedule (.477) in MLB, according to Tankathon's rankings. In contrast, the Baltimore Orioles have the 10th-easiest schedule (.496), while the Cleveland Guardians have the fourth-most difficult schedule (.520). The Yankees must capitalize on this opportunity, particularly in their upcoming series against the Orioles (Sept. 24-26) and Guardians (Aug. 20-22), to maintain their head-to-head record and secure a strong playoff push.
news knowledge.title: Yankees have key advantage over Orioles, Guardians in final playoff push

news knowledge.eng_title: Orioles vs. Yankees: Start Time, Streaming Live, TV Channel, How to Watch
news knowledge.summary: The Baltimore Orioles (57-37) will host the New York Yankees (57-39) at Oriole Park at Camden Yards on July 13, 2024, with Grayson Rodriguez and Luis Gil starting on the mound. The Orioles have won 44 of the 73 games they were the moneyline favorite this season, and have hit an MLB-leading 147 home runs. The Yankees have won 13 of the 19 games they've been the underdog this season, and have hit 135 home runs. The game will be broadcast on Fox Sports 1 and can be streamed live on Fubo.
news knowledge.title: Orioles vs. Yankees: Start Time, Streaming Live, TV Channel, How to Watch
